column2: RHODE ISLAND DMV WRITTEN TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. If you get on a wrong expressway exit, you must:
column4: make a U-turn and return to the expressway.
column6: get off at the next exit and look for signs that tell you how to return to the expressway.
column8: use the the exit ramp to accelerate to expressway speed and blend with traffic.
column10: drive in reverse to return to the expressway.

column2: 2. What does this road sign indicate?
column4: Motor vehicles entering an exclusive right-turn lane must weave across bicycle traffic in bicycle lanes.
column6: Drivers have the right of way over bikes turning left.
column8: Vehicles turning left must yield to bikes entering a right turn lane.

column2: 3. When driving in heavy rain, drivers should use:
column8: parking lights.

column2: 4. When you approach an intersection with a flashing yellow light, you must:
column8: come to a complete stop, then proceed.

column2: 5. This road sign means:
column8: Do not pass trucks

column2: 6. When driving in travel lanes on the roadway:
column4: do not stop for any reason, keep moving until you can safely pull off the road.
column6: you may make a U-turn if you get on the wrong entrance ramp of the freeway.
column8: you may make back up quickly if there are no vehicles behind.
column10: you may stop to let out passengers.

column2: 7. The picture shows a _________ sign.
column8: no sharp turn

column2: 8. To keep your vehicle from rolling into traffic when parked on a hill, if you are facing uphill you should:
column4: turn the front wheels away from the curb or edge of the road.
column6: turn the front wheels towards the curb or edge of the road.
column8: set the parking brake and keep the front wheels straight.
column10: turn the back wheels towards the curb or edge of the road.

column2: 9. At times even driving 10 MPH is too fast for existing conditions.
10. A solid yellow line on your side of the center line means:
column8: Stop

column2: 11. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: drivers in the left lane have the right-of-way
column8: the road ahead is narrow.
column10: there is a one lane bridge ahead.

column2: 12. Motorists are not required to yield to pedestrians when approaching or exiting a roundabout.
13. To avoid crashes with vehicles in your blind spots, you should:
column4: adjust your rear-view mirrors every few minutes.
column6: quickly turn your head to see if your blind spot is clear, before changing lanes.
column8: sound your horn right before turning or changing lanes.

column2: 14. If you continually pass the other vehicles on a road with one lane in each direction, you will:
column4: increase your chances of being involved in an accident.
column6: get to your destination much faster.
column8: help prevent the chances of a crash occurring due to traffic congestion.

column2: 15. The only effective way to reduce your blood alcohol content (BAC) is:
column8: not to drink over a period of time.

column2: 16. When daylight begins to fade, you should use your:
column8: high beam headlights.

column2: 17. This road sign means:
column8: No U-Turn

column2: 18. Stopping distances:
column6: are not affected by vehicle speed.
column8: increase as vehicle speed increases.

column2: 19. When passing a motorcycle you must:
column4: stay in the right lane as much as possible.
column6: give the motorcyclist the entire traffic lane as if the motorcycle was a car.
column8: sound your horn to alert the motorcyclist.
column10: give the motorcyclist the right hand part of his traffic lane.

column2: 20. It is unlawful­ to:
column4: pass within 250 feet of any intersection.
column6: exceed the posted speed limit when passing.
column8: pass within 150 feet of any railroad crossing.

column2: 21. This road sign means:
column8: No right turn

column2: 22. Before a school bus stops to load passengers, the driver will usually flash:
column8: red warning lights.

column2: 23. This sign means:
column4: If you are driving at 40 MPH or less you must stay in the right-hand lane
column6: Curve ahead, drive at 40 MPH ot more around the curve ahead
column8: If you are driving at 40 MPH or less you must turn to the right
column10: Curve ahead, the recommended speed is 40 MPH or less

column2: 24. What should you do if your brakes fail?
column6: Try pumping the brake pedal to increase pressure.
column8: Hook your shoe under the pedal and see if you can free it.

column2: 25. ___________ normally are white rectangles with black letters or symbols.
column8: Regulation signs (regulatory signs)
